    • Method Detail

      • mainLoop

        public void mainLoop()
              throws DataException,
                     RequestException
        Description copied from class: User
        The main loop of this user, which encodes user behavior. This method contains the "business flow" that the user should follow to successfully interact with the system under test. One execution of this method counts as one successful user interaction: If User.isMeasuring() when this method terminates successfully, User.loopCount() will be incremented by one. Note that the capacity of the system under test is determined by the number of times that this method completes, *not* by the number of requests that are created by this method. For instance, if one successful interaction with the system under test involves steps A *and* B, then one successful completion of User.mainLoop() still only counts for one "user interaction", even though two Request objects, one for A and one for B, might have been created. Conversely, if one "user interaction" consists of step A *or* step B, then the implementation of User.mainLoop() should take care to alternate between generating a Request for A and one for B in different executions of User.mainLoop(). Throwing any exception from within this method will have as effect that that iteration is not counted in the overall total. The exception will be logged. Failures to interact with the system under test should be handled by setting an appropriate result status for any issued Request objects (see Request.done(be.kuleuven.distrinet.scalar.requests.RequestResult)).
        Specified by:
        mainLoop in class User
        Throws:
        DataException
        RequestException

      • onStop

        public void onStop()
        Description copied from class: User
        Method for cleaning up after an experimental run. This method is called automatically when an experimental run is finished (potentially multiple times per experiment, depending on the configuration). Override this method to implement cleanup behavior (e.g., logging out after an experiment, releasing resources, etc.). Note that this method is not necessarily called when an experiment is terminated abnormally (e.g., when the master is killed with ^C). For more advanced life cycle management, implement a Plugin.
        Overrides:
        onStop in class User
